sn45.55:4.1: “Mendicants, the dawn is the forerunner and precursor of the sunrise.
sn45.55:4.3: In the same way accomplishment in rational attention is the forerunner and precursor of the noble eightfold path for a mendicant.
sn45.55:4.5: A mendicant accomplished in rational attention can expect to
sn45.55:4.6: develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path.
sn45.55:4.7: And how does a mendicant accomplished in rational attention develop and cultivate the noble eightfold path?
sn45.55:4.8: It’s when a mendicant develops right view, right motivation, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,
sn45.55:4.9: and right samādhi, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.
sn45.55:4.10: That’s how a mendicant accomplished in rational attention develops and cultivates the noble eightfold path.”
